definition: (dialect) earthen dyke in a river or rice paddy (for irrigation purposes)
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
strip of high ground/low earth dyke separating fields
earth embankment used to hold back or retain water/dike around a paddy field
Japanese variant of 濱|滨[bin1]/used in Japanese place names such as Yokohama 橫浜|横浜[Heng2 bin1] with phonetic value hama
ridge between fields/row of crops/grave mound/old variant of 壟|垄
bamboo conduit/wooden peg/spout/same as 筧|笕
